intro: Dicymbe stipitata, commonly known as the slender legume, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod-like fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred structure on the petals. Dicymbe stipitata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
